content: SSL encryption is not used by all websites, but it is highly recommended for any website that collects sensitive information from its users. Nowadays, most reputable websites, especially those that require users to submit personal data, such as passwords, credit card information, or identification data, use SSL encryption to secure their data transfer. You can easily identify if a website uses SSL encryption by looking at the web address in the browser bar. If the URL starts with "https" instead of "http," it means that the website uses SSL encryption to secure its data transfer. In addition, you will also see a padlock icon in the browser bar, which indicates that the website's SSL certificate is valid and that your data is protected.
